[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/authenticator.rs] [Attack: Abstract function injection] Can malicious function_info in AbstractAuthenticator reference arbitrary Move functions that don't properly validate signatures, bypassing authentication? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/authenticator.rs] [Attack: Keyless proof substitution] In Keyless authentication, can an attacker substitute ZK proof from one transaction into another while keeping ephemeral signature, causing verification bypass? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/authenticator.rs] [Attack: Scheme confusion] Can an attacker create authentication keys using one Scheme but submit transactions using different Scheme, exploiting hash collisions between scheme IDs? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/authenticator.rs] [Attack: Secondary signer ordering] In MultiAgent or FeePayer, can reordering secondary_signers array bypass validation that assumes specific ordering? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/authenticator.rs] [Attack: WebAuthn challenge manipulation] In WebAuthn signature verification, can an attacker manipulate client_data_json or authenticator_data to bypass origin validation while maintaining valid signature? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/authenticator.rs] [Memory] [Vector pre-allocation] At line 352, Vec is pre-allocated with MAX_NUM_OF_SIGS capacity - can attackers exploit this to allocate 32 slots even when only 1 signature is needed? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/authenticator.rs] [Memory] [Signature bytes cloning] Functions like signature_bytes() at lines 809-819 clone signature data - can repeated calls cause memory exhaustion? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/authenticator.rs] [Memory] [Public key bytes cloning] Functions like public_key_bytes() clone key material - can this be exploited in hot verification paths? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/authenticator.rs] [Memory] [MultiEd25519 expansion] Converting MultiEd25519 to MultiKey clones all public keys - can maximum size MultiEd25519 (32 keys?) cause memory issues? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/authenticator.rs] [Concurrency] [Verification parallelization] If verify() is called concurrently on same TransactionAuthenticator, can shared state or caching cause race conditions? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/authenticator.rs] [Concurrency] [Bitmap access] In MultiKeyAuthenticator, is BitVec thread-safe if verification happens concurrently? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/authenticator.rs] [Crypto] [Ed25519 malleability] Does Ed25519 signature verification check for non-canonical signatures that could enable signature malleability attacks? (High)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/authenticator.rs] [Crypto] [Secp256k1 high-s] Does Secp256k1Ecdsa verification reject high-s values to prevent signature malleability? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/authenticator.rs] [Crypto] [Hash collision resistance] SHA3-256 is used throughout for authentication key derivation - are there any known attacks or weaknesses in this usage? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/authenticator.rs] [Crypto] [Key reuse across schemes] Can the same raw key bytes be used in different AnyPublicKey variants to create authentication key collisions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/authenticator.rs] [Crypto] [Ephemeral key lifetime] In Keyless authentication, are ephemeral keys properly validated for expiration to prevent use of expired keys? (High)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/authenticator.rs] [Integer] [Signature count sum] At lines 162-167, usize values are summed - can overflow occur on 32-bit systems with many signatures? (Low)
